# Challenge contribution step by step

To celebrate the release of its new website, the MetaLab team with support of the Berkeley Initiative for Transparency in the Social Sciences [BITSS](http://bitss.org/) is organizing a challenge for authors of meta-analyses on cognitive development. This challenge will offer a total of $3,000 US in cash prizes to (teams of) authors who contribute their meta-analysis data to the MetaLab database. 

If you wish to participate, here are the steps that you should follow:
1. As soon as possible, sign up [here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1YtZr2gBulKdT7DkmHkUj1MPyjy_bwS6tDw1MigoOQ1Y/edit) to inform us that you wish to contribute and so that we send you important updates. 
2. Code your meta-analytic data using the [MetaLab template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12Y_2BcFSu48t0F8a_xrY1Ro2fJoCIV1h8O627WNcrjY/edit).
3. Send us your data spreadsheet and optional documents for bonus points (PRISMA flowchart, decision spreadsheetâ€¦) at metalab-project@googlegroups.com at any time. We will check it and get back to you to confirm that you contribution is accepted and give you feedback on your submission.

The challenges closes on June, 30. You will be informed of the results of the challenge by email shortly after.

Please reach out to us if you have any question.
